recap_documents.description: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that Plaintiffs' motion to compel (Doc. 253 ) is granted in part and denied in part. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the RPA must, within seven days of the issuance of this order, produce all of the documents identified on its attorney-client privilege log, with the exception of (1) the documents that were identified as Nos. 24, 25, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 107, 111, 119, and 120 in the initial version of the RPA's privilege log and (2) the documents in the initial version of the RPA's privilege log that were "RNC Election Law Updates" from Specht. As for those documents, the RPA must, within 14 days of the issuance of this order, provide Plaintiffs with a legally compliant attorney-client privilege log. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the RPA must, within seven days of the issuance of this order, produce all of the documents identified on its First Amendment privilege log, with the exception of the documents that have since been identified as auto-generated emails related to donations. As for those documents, the RPA must, within seven days of the issuance of this order, provide certification to Plaintiffs as to what it has done to confirm those documents' non-responsiveness. (See document for complete details). Signed by Judge Dominic W Lanza on 11/8/2023. (SLQ) (Entered: 11/08/2023)
